sections.title: Description
sections.raw_content: The date statement is used to determine the current date. Variable d is assigned a string in the format "dd mmm yy", where mmm is the first 3 characters of the month, e.g., "Apr". For example, if the date is Christmas 2002, d will be set to "25 Dec 02".
sections.text_content: The date statement is used to determine the current date. Variable d is assigned a string in the format "dd mmm yy", where mmm is the first 3 characters of the month, e.g., "Apr". For example, if the date is Christmas 2002, d will be set to "25 Dec 02".
sections.mdown_content: The **date** statement is used to determine the current date. Variable _d_ is assigned a string in the format "_dd mmm yy_", where _mmm_ is the first 3 characters of the month, e.g., "_Apr_". For example, if the date is Christmas 2002, _d_ will be set to "_25 Dec 02_".

sections.title: Example
code:
var today : string
        date (today)
        put "Greetings!!  The date today is ", today
sections.raw_content: This program greets you and tells you the date.
sections.text_content: This program greets you and tells you the date.
sections.mdown_content: This program greets you and tells you the date.

sections.title: Details
sections.raw_content: Be warned that Turing gets the date from the operating system. If the date is is not correctly set in the operating system, then the date procedure will give incorrect results.
sections.text_content: Be warned that Turing gets the date from the operating system. If the date is is not correctly set in the operating system, then the date procedure will give incorrect results.
sections.mdown_content: Be warned that Turing gets the date from the operating system. If the date is is not correctly set in the operating system, then the **date** procedure will give incorrect results.
